meta.videoTitle: How to Prevent & Treat Colds & Flu

paragraphList.text_en: Regular exercise has long been touted for its numerous health benefits, including supporting the immune system and helping to prevent sickness. The intensity and duration of exercise play a crucial role in determining how it affects the body's defense system. A review published in the Journal of Sport and Health Science in 2019 sheds light on the intricate relationship between physical activity and the immune system.
paragraphList.text_zh: 定期锻炼长期以来一直被称赞其众多的健康益处，包括支持免疫系统并有助于预防疾病。锻炼的强度和持续时间在决定它如何影响身体防御系统方面起着至关重要的作用。2019年发表在《体育与健康科学杂志》上的一项评论揭示了体力活动与免疫系统之间复杂关系。

paragraphList.text_en: Engaging in exercise that is of moderate to high intensity, lasting no more than 60 minutes, can have a positive impact on the body's innate immune system. This type of exercise promotes the exchange of components between the blood and the lymphatic system, enhancing the circulation of immune cells and chemicals that bolster the body's ability to combat infections such as colds and flu. The heightened activity of the immune system can persist for up to 24 hours post-exercise, providing an extended period of protection.
paragraphList.text_zh: 参加持续时间不超过60分钟的中高强度运动对身体固有的免疫系统有积极影响。这种类型的运动促进了血液和淋巴系统之间组分的交换，增强了免疫细胞和化学物质的循环，增强了身体对感冒和流感等感染的抵抗能力。免疫系统的活跃水平可以持续到运动后的24小时，提供了持续保护的时间。

paragraphList.text_en: While moderate to high-intensity exercise for shorter durations proves beneficial for immune function, it is important to note that excessive exercise can have the opposite effect. Individuals who engage in prolonged and intense physical activity, such as running a marathon, may experience a significant downturn in immune function. Running a marathon or engaging in similar strenuous activities can lead to a decrease in T-cell function, natural killer cell activity, and an increase in stress hormones and inflammatory molecules. This immune compromise highlights the importance of maintaining a balance in exercise intensity and duration to support optimal immune function.
paragraphList.text_zh: 在短时间内进行中至高强度的适度运动对免疫功能是有益的，但需要注意的是，过度运动会产生相反的效果。那些参与长时间和强度大的体育活动，比如跑马拉松的个体，可能会经历免疫功能的显著下降。跑马拉松或从事类似的高强度活动可能会导致T细胞功能下降、自然杀伤细胞活性减弱，并增加压力激素和炎症分子。这种免疫妥协凸显了维持运动强度和持续时间平衡以支持免疫功能的重要性。

paragraphList.text_en: For those seeking to enhance immune system function through exercise, it is not necessary to engage in long bouts of activity on a daily basis. Studies suggest that as little as 20 minutes of exercise per day can elicit improvements in the innate immune response. Shorter bouts of high-intensity training, such as 12 minutes of vigorous exercise, have also been shown to have a positive impact on immune function. Incorporating a mix of cardiovascular and resistance training, while being mindful of not overdoing it, can help maintain a healthy immune system.
paragraphList.text_zh: 对于那些希望通过运动增强免疫系统功能的人来说，并不需要每天进行长时间的活动。研究表明，每天仅需进行20分钟的运动就可以促进先天免疫反应的改善。短时间高强度训练，比如12分钟的剧烈运动，也被证明对免疫功能有积极影响。结合有氧运动和抗阻训练，同时注意不要过度做运动，有助于保持健康的免疫系统。

paragraphList.text_en: In conclusion, exercise plays a vital role in supporting the body's defense system and reducing the risk of illness. By understanding the optimal intensity and duration of exercise, individuals can harness its immune-boosting benefits while avoiding the negative consequences of excessive physical activity. A balanced approach to exercise, incorporating both moderate and high-intensity workouts in appropriate durations, can help individuals strengthen their immune system and promote overall well-being.
paragraphList.text_zh: 总之，运动在支持身体的防御系统和减少疾病风险方面发挥着至关重要的作用。通过了解适当的运动强度和持续时间，个人可以利用其提高免疫力的益处，同时避免过度体力活动的负面影响。平衡的运动方式，包括适当持续时间的中等和高强度训练，可以帮助个人增强免疫系统，促进整体健康。
